column22: and do not make my task too hard for me.' They continued on their journey until they met a youth and the servant of God killed him. Moses said
column23: 'Have you killed an innocent person without justification? Indeed

column2: When They Embarked On A Boat

column1: (Khidr) Said: ‘Did I Not Tell You That You Would Not Be Able To Restrain Yourself In My Company?’

column1: Then Both Of Them Proceeded Till They Met A Boy. (Khidr) Killed Him. Musa (Moses) Said: ‘Have You Killed A Harmless Soul Without Any (Retribution Due) For Anyone Killed? Indeed
column2: You Have Done A Horrible Thing!’

column1: (Khidr) Said: ‘Did I Not Tell You That You Would Never Be Able To Keep Patience In My Company?’
Musa (Moses) Said: ‘If I Ask You About Anything After This
column2: Then Do Not Keep Me With You. Indeed
column3: In My Opinion
column4: You Have Reached The Limit To Excuse.’

column2: Until They Reached The People Of A Town; Both Asked Its Residents For Food But They Refused To Entertain Them. Then They Found There A Wall
column3: Which Was About To Fall. (Khidr) Erected It. Musa (Moses) Said: ‘If You Desired
column4: You Could Take Wages For This (Construction Work).’

column1: (Khidr) Said: ‘This Is The Parting (Time) Between Me And You. Now I Shall Impart To You The Truth Of The Matters About Which You Have Not Been Able To Keep Patience.

column2: That Belonged To Some Poor People Who Used To Toil For Wages On The River. So I Decided To Make It Defective (Because) A (Cruel) King Was (Standing) Ahead Of Them
column3: Snatching Every (Undamaged) Boat By Force (From The Owners Without Any Compensation).

column2: His Parents Were Blessed With Faith. So We Feared That (If He Lived On
column3: He Would Become A Disbeliever
column4: And On Attaining To Maturity) He Would Afflict Both Of Them With Disobedience And Disbelief.

column1: So We Intended That Their Lord Might Bless Them With (Such) A Substitute As Would Be Better Than This (Boy) In Purity And Nearer (To His Parents As Well) In Clemency And Kindness.
